posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we‚Äôre releasing version 7.66 to beta. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Message status indicators (sent, delivered, etc.) are now supported by the iOS VoiceOver feature in order to improve accessibility for blind and low-vision individuals.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.65 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.66.0.854-beta

42 new commits since 7.65.0.845-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.66 [1]

  • Remove unecessary owsAssertDebug; we may have uploadEra set after legacy link'n'syncs but it will be wiped in the future [2]

  • Fix inverted bool on list media check [3]

  • Asyncify ‚Äúfor a friend‚Äù‚Äôs startJob method [4]

  • Asyncify BadgeThanksSheet [5]

  • Asyncify ‚Äúfor a friend‚Äù recipient selection [6]

  • Asyncify showSafetyNumberConfirmationIfNecessary [7]

  • Adjust socket reconnect delays [8]

  • Schedule unknown profile fetches synchronously [9]

  • Ensure digest we use on transitTierInfo is from the appropriate encryption key [10]

  • Preserve discoverability when resetting registration state [11]

  • Skip list media if backupPlan is disabled [12]

  • Allow error notifications when not registered [13]

  • Allow deregistered notifications when deregistered [14]

  • Adjust remote config ‚Äúenabled‚Äù parsing logic [15]

  • Import/export AccountSettings.backupTier (libsignal v0.75.1) [16]

  • Add Backup overnight BGProcessingTask [17]

  • Incorporate attachment size into last backup size [18]

  • Fix topViewController for tabs other than the chat list [19]

  • Fix Xcode 26 build [20]

  • Re-enabling backups doesn't update Backup Settings [21]

  • Check shouldSocketBeOpen when taking over from NSE [22]

  • Handle session interrupts for AVCaptureSession [23]

  • Use Retry.performWithBackoff for avatar downloads [24]

  • Add cancellation support to ConcurrentTaskQueue [25]

  • Serialize local profile commitment checks [26]

  • Start the upload queue when setting paid BackupPlan, add UploadEraStore [27]

  • Assorted fixes for upload progress reporting [28]

  • Add and use BackupSettingsAttachmentUploadTracker [29]

  • Use non-cancellable run method in AsyncAtomic [30]

  • Simplify BackupAttachment upload progress incrementing [31]

  • Add DispatchQueue-backed Monitor functions [32]

  • Replace inline logic with is5xxServiceResponse [33]

  • Don‚Äôt report cancellations as sealed cert failures [34]

  • Show ‚ÄúSending‚Ä¶‚Äù while waiting for socket to open [35]

  • Prepare the connection earlier in the launch flow [36]

  • Don‚Äôt reach out to globals in warmCaches [37]

  • Observe registration changes after app is ready [38]

  • Verify PNI & identity key exist on linked devices [39]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.76.1 [40]

  • Update release notes [41]

  • Update translations [42]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.65.0.845-beta‚Ä¶7.66.0.854-beta

posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked: Wasnt this in the last release already?

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: Yeah seems like just a copied changelog. It‚Äôs actually seemingly just prep for backups.

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked: I am an Android user, and I am noticing that my iOS contacts aren‚Äôt receiving my messages. I see only a single checkmark. I doubt that me being an Android user is related but putting it out there just in case. This has been going on a couple days already

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: Have them do the re-registration for push notifications: https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318711-Troubleshooting-Notifications#ios_notifications_troubleshooting

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
I will try that. Why doesn‚Äôt this happen in WhatsApp?
I doubt that‚Äôs the problem. I find it strange that Signal has these peculiarities which make is use awkward compared to mainstream alternatives

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
sigfun:

I will try that. Why doesn‚Äôt this happen in WhatsApp?

I‚Äôve had my own contacts follow that process and it has fixed the issue. If it doesn‚Äôt, then it‚Äôs a network problem on the receiving end.

I presume, if it‚Äôs not a network issue, this can happen because Signal does a lot of custom work in the notification pipeline to keep data hidden from Apple, and WhatsApp does not.

sigfun:

I find it strange that Signal has these peculiarities which make is use awkward compared to mainstream alternatives

Mainstream apps aren‚Äôt as secure or private as Signal. Maintaining the high bar Signal has self-imposed for both requires a fair number of bespoke techniques. There are endless examples on Signal‚Äôs blog.

Edit: there was also this effort a couple years ago when iOS notifications were really bad: Can you help us debug broken notifications on iOS (with Apple)?

link_counts.title: Can you help us debug broken notifications on iOS (with Apple)?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Couldn‚Äôt transfer my history from Android to iPad:

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.66.0/e0a72b1e2eb2c7bd56e82fdce8770f249fde29ec092e5b44197f56bcf168fda0.zip

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.67 release.
